items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.   
We continue to monitor the situation.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River levels have risen on the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster due to prolonged heavy showers and some thunderstorms.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including low lying areas around Ambleside, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel.
Further showers are forecast this evening but these are expected to lessen in the next few hours.
River levels are forecast to level off and begin to fall overnight as the showers decrease.
We will continue to monitor levels closely and we have been clearing debris screens and checking rivers for blockages
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 16/07/2023, or as the situation changes.
